title: Prices
text: table of contents adding a new price list search for an existing price list column chooser edit item prices edit variable item prices using the search item fields certain companies may maintain multiple price lists that are specific to different shops or locations. these price lists are established and utilized when transferring or relocating items or inventory between various locations or businesses. if you haven't set any price lists yet, you'll notice that the price list table appears empty and shows a message that says "no data". adding a new price list step 1: to begin creating a price list click the +add price list button. step 2: provide a new name for the price list that can be easily referenced. then, select the appropriate source and destination from the dropdown menu. step 3: click the +create price list. step 4: to begin populating your price list, you can use the items/vendor and hierarchy dropdowns to filter for specific items see using the "search item fields" for more information. alternatively, you can utilize the +add items button to add items directly. step 5: to add items directly, click on the +add items button to open a new window where you can further filter your search. you can use the search box to find items by information such as item number, vendor, and name. you can also use the "show inactive" toggle to view inactive items. step 6: after selecting the items, you can click on the "add items" button by marking the checkbox next to each item. step 7: your items will now be listed in the home page, from here you can set the prices or delete items if necessary. step 8: to modify the price of an item, simply select the "edit" icon and input the updated price. remember to click on the "save" icon to ensure the changes are saved. if you wish to remove an item, click on the "bin icon" and confirm the deletion. search for an existing price list if you have an existing price list, you can utilize the search fields in combination with the dropdown menu to refine your search results. search for name this is the name given to the price list at creation. source this is the source that was selected during the creation of the price list. destination this is the destination that was selected during the creation of the price list. column chooser when adding items from the items list you can use to column chooser to narrow down which columns you see. click the column chooser icon and from here you can drag and drop columns depending on the information you wish to see. edit variable item prices a parent item may have variables that are set, such as items that come in various colors or sizes. if these variables are available, they will be displayed below using the dropdown icon. you have the option to set individual prices for each variable, if applicable. using the search item fields you can add specific items using the item search fields. items all: this will search all items. only items with prices: this will search all items with a price set. only items without prices: this will search all items without a price set. vendor select the vendors available to your tenant. hierarchy this is the item level which was set when the item was created. search this can be used to narrow down the search using a item number or item name.
